Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014027689.CaseDesc: Sindy Ruperthouse's family has had no news of her since April 2014 and on September 2, 2014, they reported her missing to the Sûreté du Québec of Amos. Mrs. Ruperthouse was last seen in Val d'Or on April 22, 2014 during a consultation at the Local Community Service Centre (CLSC).

Case reference: 2018040311.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2003, Karanjeet Singh was seen for the last time as he left with some of his personal belongings to go visit a friend in Toronto, Ontario. Karanjeet was visiting Toronto from India and was due to return on May 24.

Case reference: 2014006270.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Daniel Pierre was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was driving a rented 2014 black Jeep Grand Cherokee, and was accompanied by his reddish brown, with a white chest, male pit-bull. The vehicle was subsequently located on the corner of Deguire Boulevard and Ashton Street in the Ville Saint-Laurent neighbourhood in Montreal. Daniel is a diabetic and depends on medication that is not in his possession.

Case reference: 2014001603.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1992, Richard Liboiron was seen for the last time as he left a hotel in Gatineau, Quebec. Mr. Liboiron and a friend departed from the hotel on a snowmobile heading in the direction towards Ottawa. The two crossed the Ottawa River and did not make it to the shore.

Case reference: 2018055666.CaseDesc: On October 18, 1991, Kristina Rhodes was seen for the last time in Port Elgin, Ontario. Kristina was also known to frequent the towns of Southampton and Hanover, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020028.CaseDesc: Chantelle Bushie was reported missing by her family on September 14, 2009. She has not been heard from since December 2007. Chantelle was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 1998000820.CaseDesc: Tom Marsden was last seen at a bush party near Summit Lake north of the City of Prince George.

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2022039393.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2022, Angela Breau was seen for the last time at her residence in Moncton, New Brunswick. She left her residence without her dentures, wallet, or other personal effects.  At the time of her disappearance, Angela was suffering from mental health issues and she has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020013833.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2020, Dylan Ehler was seen for the last time as he wandered off in Truro, Nova Scotia. Following his disappearance, Dylan’s rubber boots were discovered in a nearby brook by divers. This brook flows into a river that flows with the Bay of Fundy.

Jacket: Dark Green, Camo with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2014002751.CaseDesc: Rebecca Guno was last seen in June of 1983 by her common law husband. Miss Guno was taking a bus downtown with an unknown female friend, but did not arrive at her intended destination.

Case reference: 2014002651.CaseDesc: Mabel Leo was last seen leaving a party near Nairn Falls, Pemberton, BC, in 1969, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005821.CaseDesc: Jacques Joseph Duguay was reported missing on May 31, 1982 from Saint John, New Brunswick. On May 25th, 1982, his vehicle, a 1975 Chevrolet half-ton pickup truck was towed from Berry Mills highway just outside Moncton, New Brunswick. The vehicle had been there since May 21st, 1982.

Case reference: 2022017854.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2022, Laura Huebner was last seen at the Victoria International airport in Sidney, British Columbia.  Sometime later that same day, she had travelled to Nanaimo. Laura has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Long sandy blonde hair

Case reference: 2014004206.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1988, 3 people were visiting Leonard Kalichak at his residence and had decided to go out in a boat on Lake Dauphin, Manitoba. When they left shore they were faced with adverse conditions subsequently capsizing the boat. At this point, Mr. Kalichak immediately went under the water, possibly as a result of heavy clothing or an injury sustained when the boat capsized. Searches were conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations on the lake. Leonard Kalichak has never been found and he is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014005574.CaseDesc: Judy Chescue was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 1988.  Judy was last seen near her home in Edmonton in July 1988.

Case reference: 2014003706.CaseDesc: Albert Crow and a friend attempted to cross Harrop Lake, Manitoba in a canoe despite high winds and the rough water. A second party in another canoe was ahead of Mr. Crow's and observed at one point of the crossing that the canoe was no longer visible. Searches were made of the shoreline and dragging operations of the lake were undertaken at the time without success. On October 12, 1974, the body of Mr. Crow's friend was recovered. His cause of death was later determined to be drowning. Albert Crow is presumed also dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2017001353.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2016 at 2:00 a.m., Derek Ritz was last seen on foot in Sebringville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005303.CaseDesc: On November 7, 2008, Van Do was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Van had indicated that he was intending to travel to Kitchener, Ontario to visit his friends. His wallet, bankcards and a packed suitcase were found in his home.

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2020007818.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1972, at approximately 12:00pm, Harvey Tulley was seen for the last time by the building’s superintendent in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Harvey was despondent.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Thumb, Bent towards index finger

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2023068017.CaseDesc: Earl Moberg was last seen on December 12, 2023 at the family home in the River East District of Winnipeg, Manitoba. Earl suffers from dementia, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Dark Blue, Green, Parka, dark blue or green

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2014004578.CaseDesc: Donald Tardif was last seen on August 7, 2003. He fell from his boat, a 14-foot motorboat, on Lake Devenyns in the unorganized territories north of St-Michel-des-Saints. Donald has never been seen since.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Calf, Tibia and fibula fragments

Case reference: 2014005630.CaseDesc: Melissa Janette Ekkelenkamp was last seen on July 06, 2011 when she left the Alberta Hospital located in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005330.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2009, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Rose Mackinnon was seen for the last time when she left the Earnestine Women’s shelter with her two children. Rose advised that she would be returning but has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001970.CaseDesc: On December 20, 1996, Wayne Hansen was seen for the last time as he checked himself out of a hospital in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004085.CaseDesc: On December 27, 1999, Simon Farah was seen for the last time at his residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Simon was suffering from mental health issues. He has not been seen and has not given any news to his family, which is contrary to his habits.

Case reference: 2020007343.CaseDesc: Marie Lyons had been living with her aunt after she had fled from her abusive husband. On April 12, 1971, Marie was last seen when her husband picked her up from her aunt’s residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shoes: Brown, Laced; Low cut with laces

Case reference: 2021037665.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2021 Donald Preston was reported missing in Quesnel, British Columbia and was last seen on July 31, 2021 in Kersley, British Columbia. It is possible that Donald may have travelled east to New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2022055259.CaseDesc: Terry Ramsay was reported missing on October 31, 2022, from the community of Heron Springs, in Fredericton, New Brunswick. Terry's automobile was found in a forested area west of Fredericton on November 5, 2023. A ground search of the region yielded negative results, even with the assistance of drones and a helicopter.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2006016899.CaseDesc: Lisa Maas was last seen leaving a party in the Woodford area.

Case reference: 2014002212.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1996, Elizabeth "Betty" Primeau was last seen while berry picking in the Torch River area near Choiceland, Saskatchewan. Elizabeth was with a group of other individuals prior to being reported missing. Extensive searches have failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2017047772.CaseDesc: On August 15, 2017, Moacir Ferrari was seen for the last time leaving his home with his belongings in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish. They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2018067156.CaseDesc: On November 27, 2018, Courtney James was seen for the last time on security camera footage in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017074237.CaseDesc: On November 17, 1999, the partial remains of an adult male were discovered in a wooded area off of Tower Road, south of the Town of Mactier, in Severn Township, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020019.CaseDesc: Emerson Dobroskay, was last seen on October 28, 1988 at the Pit Pub located at the University of British Columbia. It is believed that Emerson may have fallen into a large pit dug for construction, but all searches have failed to locate him. Although foul play is not suspected, it cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2007002399.CaseDesc: Marilyn Neely was last seen by a friend on September 18, 1983, driving Southbound on Goodfellow Road, in the county of Peterborough. Her vehicle, a 1975 Dodge Dart, was later found on the Five Point Trail access road approximately 11 km west of Hwy #507. That same day a woman matching her description was seen walking west along the road from that location.

Purse: Green, White, vinyl with a white shoulder strap

Case reference: 2014003036.CaseDesc: Originally from Winnipeg, Manitoba, Regan Pace Ambrose is believed to have gone missing in Japan. After being recruited to work at a Japanese hospital, Miss Ambrose moved to Tokuyama, Yamaguchi, Japan. She was last seen on January 11, 1998 after finishing a shift at work. She was reportedly seen in the area of Mount Aso in Kumamoto, Kyushu Japan on January 10th, 1998. Japanese and Canadian authorities investigated; however, met with negative results.

Case reference: 2008015499.CaseDesc: Sheryl Sheppard was last seen on January 2 1998, on Lundy's Lane in Niagara Falls, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Hamilton Police Service was conducted but Sheryl Sheppard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2023053313.CaseDesc: Kyle Hancock was last seen in St. Thomas, Ontario, on August 2, 2023. Kyle's phone hasn't been connected to any network since he was last observed, and his bank account hasn't been accessed.

Case reference: 2024018918.CaseDesc: Benjamin Sullivan was last seen on January 6th, 2024 and reported missing on April 21, 2024 from Moncton, New Brunswick.  Benjamin has not been seen or heard from since July 2023. Benjamin is known to live a transient lifestyle and does not have a fixed address. Extensive searches around the City of Moncton, including verifications at shelters and hospitals have been unsuccessful in locating Benjamin.

Case reference: 2018005079.CaseDesc: Joshua Hawkins was last seen on January 28, 2018, at approximately 6pm when he left the Brockville General Hospital without being discharged.

Tattoo: Right Calf, Lion and dragon with the word Kaitlyn
Right Upper Arm, Outline of a heart
Right Leg, Skull and hand holding a flame - on the front of the leg

Case reference: 2012020094.CaseDesc: Gordon Harvey was last seen on July 24, 2008, at approximately 2130 hours. He was swimming in the Saskatchewan River near Cranberry Flats, south of Saskatoon, SK. Personal clothing and articles of identification belonging to Mr. Harvey were recovered on the shore near where he was last seen swimming.

Case reference: 2014008479.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2014 William Grange was on vacation at the Cambridge Beach Resort and Spa in Bermuda. In the evening, he walked away from the resort.

Jewelry: Gold, wedding band with one diamond
Scar: Unknown, Small white scar, approx. 3" long, on top of hand, unknown right or left hand
Left Side Of Head, Surgical scar on left side of head/scalp from brain surgery

Case reference: 2020008361.CaseDesc: On May 12, 1991, at approximately 4:00pm, Ian Dickson was last seen leaving a restaurant near Yonge Street and Eglington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Ian was visiting from Scotland, and was due to return on May 23, but he did not board his flight.

Case reference: 2008011099.CaseDesc: Michael Hart left the Langton area to look for work in Western Canada as a skilled tradesman. He had maintained contact with his parents by telephone and through his banking. His parents are worried as they have had no contact with him since May 24, 1996.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2006008099.CaseDesc: Wilbert James Coulter's abandoned pick-up truck was located on December 28, 1990 on an old snowmobile trail in the Bancroft, Ontario area.  Search of the area failed to locate Mr. Coulter.

Case reference: 2014002912.CaseDesc: On June 29, 1982, Serge Aumont was seen for the last time in the Hochelaga district of Montreal, Quebec. Serge left his mother’s home with a friend to go to a medical clinic. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Foreign Object: Mouth, Upper and lower partial dentures

Case reference: 2007005299.CaseDesc: Shelley Mathieu-Read resided in Sarnia, Ontario. She was last seen on May 20, 2007 in Sarnia but has not been heard from since. An extensive investigation by the Sarnia Police Service has failed to locate her.

Scar: Forehead, from hairline running down into forhead
Tattoo: Right Foot, graphic of a star

Case reference: 2016026140.CaseDesc: Amber Wilson was last seen at 9:30pm on May 15, 2016, in Edmonton's downtown area. Amber has medical issues, and she is dependent on her medication. Amber lives a high risk lifestyle, and it is out of character for her not to be in contact with her family. Her family is extremely concerned for her welfare.

Case reference: 2012020050.CaseDesc: Shirley Lonethunder originally from White Bear First Nation near Carlyle, SK went missing from downtown Saskatoon, SK on the afternoon of December 24, 1991.

Case reference: 2018008750.CaseDesc: On February 17, 2018, Ryan Shtuka was last seen at approximately 2:10 am and was believed to have left a party on Burfield Drive to walk home to his residence located a short distance away in Sun Peaks. Ryan did not attend his job as scheduled later that day and has not been active on social media or his cell phone since.

Shirt: White, Grey, Button Up, Grey arms and collar, partial button up
Shoes: Size 11, flat bottom sole shoes similar to VANS

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2006025399.CaseDesc: Walter Mesem was last seen on April 25, 1982, driving his vehicle in the Eldorado area. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Mesem.

Coat: Green, Hand knitted cuffs, zippered front

Case reference: 2014002695.CaseDesc: Harold Wagner was last seen on June 4, 1988, at Fur Lake in the Mont Nebo district, SK. Mr. Wagner was swimming from his boat when he disappeared.

Shorts: Cloth, White, Red, White swim trunks with red, blue and red stripes

Case reference: 2019068654.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2019, Lara Parkin was seen for the last time in the South-West District of Montreal, Quebec. Lara is known to frequent Montreal’s downtown area and parks. She is also known to travel by foot or by public transit. During the time of her disappearance, Lara left her apartment without bringing any of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014002896.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1981, at around 10:00pm, Madeleine Thibault was seen for the last time on Commercial Road in Lévis, Québec. While leaving her house, Madeleine mentioned that she was going to her mother's for a visit.

Jewelry: Gold, COLLIER, Chain with two hearts
Mark: Mouth, Beauty mark on the left side

Case reference: 2014004899.CaseDesc: Claude Barbier was last seen on November 16, 1996, with his girlfriend at the Cooke residence in Trois-Rivières. On November 18, 1996, the body of his girlfriend was pulled from the St-Lawrence River near St-Antoine-de-Tilly. Mr. Barbier has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006021799.CaseDesc: Leo Payash, aged 8, was last seen on July 01, 1957. He and his mother Cecilia Payash, aged 48 years, were walking on Red Lake Road and neither has been seen since.

Deformity: Nose, Described as having a "hooked" nose

Case reference: 2012020040.CaseDesc: Jerry Paquette was last seen on the Louis Bull First Nations Reserve on January 1, 1982.

Case reference: 2014004399.CaseDesc: On November 23rd, 2003 Donna Bakker was last observed leaving her residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. The following day, her vehicle was located abandoned in Niagara Falls, New York.  Donna's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2023045401.CaseDesc: Dany Côté has been missing from the municipality of Rivière-Bleue, Québec since August 17, 2023.  It is unusual for Dany to go for extended lengths of time without communicating with his family or friends. Due to medical conditions, Dany has difficulty walking and rarely leaves his apartment. He performs errands in the immediate area of his home which happens to be near a river that flows into the waters of the State of Maine, USA.

Jacket: Blue, Grey, Blue and grey winter jacket
Pants: Black, Black sport pants with a white line
Amputation: Left Little Finger, Left little finger is amputated
Scar: Right Hand, Scar on the right hand
Left Hand, Scar on the left hand

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2014005328.CaseDesc: In October 1986, Frances Neilson was observed by family leaving her residence in Edmonton, Alberta in the family vehicle. A few days later the vehicle was recovered but Frances has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2007003099.CaseDesc: Christina Calayca was camping with friends at Rainbow Falls Provincial Park located near Schreiber, Ontario. At approximately 6:30 am Ms. Calayca indicated to a friend that she was going jogging and was last observed on a park campground roadway. Ms. Calayca never returned to her campsite and has not been heard from since. An extensive ground and air search has been conducted by the Ontario Provincial Police but Ms. Calayca has not been located.

Case reference: 2006013599.CaseDesc: Donald Taylor has been missing from South Porcupine, Ontario since August 24, 1989 at 7:00 in the morning and has not been seen since.

Boots: Leather, Tan, "Kodiak" Steel toe work boots

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2014004122.CaseDesc: Maria Evangelista was last seen on January 27, 1997, in Montreal. Maria had called her mother to tell her that she no longer wanted to return to the hospital and would like to work in California. Maria's luggage was found in a hotel, in San Francisco, on February 7, 1997.

Case reference: 2012020064.CaseDesc: On June 24, 2000, Irma Murdock was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. It is believed that Irma may have travelled to Vancouver, British Colombia.

Case reference: 2006024199.CaseDesc: Diane Cudmore was last seen on February 22, 1972, before she wandered away from her home. Diane was known to have mental health issues that may have played a part in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014006050.CaseDesc: On April 3, 2013, Mr. Patrice Mathieu was reported missing from his home in St-Joseph-de-Sorel. He was last seen the day before. Mr. Mathieu does not own a car, however he does have a driver's licence. Mr. Mathieu usually travels on foot. He is quiet and is, by nature, anxious and withdrawn.

Coat: Black, Mid-thigh length with a hood

Case reference: 2021055005.CaseDesc: On July 31, 2016, Karen Thompson was last seen at her daughter’s birthday party at Prince of Whales Park in Toronto, Ontario.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Elephant on left or right shoulder
Lower Back, 3 skulls on lower back

Case reference: 2018063001.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1995, at around midnight, Ying Zhu was last seen by her boyfriend when he dropped her off at her home in Toronto, Ontario. The following day, her boyfriend arrived at Ying’s work to pick her up and found out that she had quit her job the previous week.

Case reference: 2014003349.CaseDesc: On March 14, 1993, Carl Berg Ellingsen was seen for the last time with his family at his residence in the East Vancouver region of British Columbia. Carl has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2023037881.CaseDesc: Kristopher Billette was last seen at approximately 7 a.m. on July 14, 2023, on the Buffalo River Dene First Nation, in Saskatchewan. An extensive search of the Buffalo River Dene Nation and along Highway 925 was conducted with no success. Kristopher has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003816.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1992, Stéphane Murray left his residence in the Beauport area to attend an appointment. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Death's head and a bat

Case reference: 2014002363.CaseDesc: On January 7, 1997, Darcy Puddicomb was seen for the last time. He departed his residence that morning with the intention of attending work. He did not arrive.

Case reference: 2003006900.CaseDesc: Krzysztof Syrzycki was last seen in Coquitlam, British Columbia on June 29, 2002.

Case reference: 2014005291.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1990, at approximately 6:50am, Ann Lylyck was last seen by her friend when he dropped her and her dog off at the Our Lady of Mercy Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. Ann was intending on visiting her aunt, but wanted to walk her dog before going into the hospital. When her friend returned a few hours later, Ann could not be located.

Case reference: 2014002370.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1997, at approximately 4:30 pm Kelvin Zdarski and two friends left Dauphin, Manitoba and headed for a cabin near Waterhen, Manitoba. Over the course of the evening there was an argument between the men. Kelvin left the cabin and never returned. The men looked for him on their way back to Dauphin and did not see him. A man matching Kelvin's description was seen walking on the road at 7:30 am on the 17th of June. An extensive search by land, air and water proved negative. Kelvin did not take his wallet, money or any identification to the cabin and had no means of transportation. Mr. Zdarski has not been seen or heard from again.

Scar: Left Calf, 1 inch long, back of calf

Case reference: 2014005495.CaseDesc: David Harrison Powell went missing on September 22, 2010. David was last seen leaving his residence. His vehicle and other important property were left behind.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Ankle, Unhealed fracture, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2009002599.CaseDesc: Mark Mayhew was residing with family at a residence in Sturgeon Falls. He left overnight without notice. There was no incident which upset him and caused him to leave. Mark was on foot, he had no vehicle and no known destination.

Teeth: False, No teeth; had false teeth but was not wearing them at the time.
